content: Do any of the open source implementations include a reference SQL schema?
I recall that Grahame did at one point... here you go: http://www.healthintersections.com.au/?s=sql++schema - a few years old though...
Thanks, @David Hay . Yeah, a bit dated. Maybe someone else has something more recent?
depends what kind of schema you want. I'm still using that fundamental schema
but that's probably not the kind of schema you want.
Ah was just wondering the same thing

Mine is more explicit than this, and is very similar to what the SQL version of SPARK has now moved towards.
But in concept, similar. Storing blobs, history and indexes seperately. (my setup has a table for each resource, and search index)
